message.content:
There are several ways to clean a retainer, including soaking it in cleaning solutions, using soap and water, or ultrasonic cleaners.

1. Soaking your retainer:
a. In denture/retainer cleaner: Mix the cleaner with warm water according to the product's instructions and soak the retainer for the recommended time.
b. In mouthwash: Some people prefer soaking their retainers in alcohol-free mouthwash diluted with an equal amount of lukewarm water.
c. In white vinegar mixed with water (50% each): This is another alternative for soaking retainers; do so for about 15-30 minutes.

2. Brushing gently with mild dish soap and warm water - With a soft toothbrush or small brush specifically designed for retainers, gently scrub all parts of your retainer prior to rinsing thoroughly under running warm water.

3. Using an ultrasonic cleaner - These devices create high-frequency vibrations that help remove debris from hard-to-reach areas on your retainer while immersed in warm tap water inside the unit.

4. Do not use bleach or boiling-hot liquids since both can damage certain types/materials used in making some orthodontic appliances like Essix-like clear aligner type retainers or Hawley wire acrylic plates retainers.

No matter which method you choose, remember always to scratch off any persistent plaque/tartar/calculus by using either dental floss threader tips or specialized interproximal dental picks/claw-type mini-pronged tweezers found at many pharmacies or online retailers without damaging retention options/devices

Finally, rinse your appliance thoroughly before putting it back into storage case/safe container when not worn actively protecting teeth alignment especially against night bruxism/grinding habits("nightguard
